intro: Arthropogon villosus var. glabrescens, commonly known as the silky grass or glabrous arthropogon, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as savannas and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological systems in its native range.
